quest.name: Lady of the Vortex
journal: With Cid's modifications now installed, the Enterprise is finally ready to make the journey to the Howling Eye.

Stirred by the familiar roar of the Enterprise's engines, Cid endeavors to recall his past; try though he might, he is unable to navigate the dark corridors of his mind alone. But what if he had company? Wielding the power of the Echo, you guide him through a series of forgotten memories, detailing the path that led the once-loyal engineer to turn his back on Garlemald and flee to Eorzea. When you finally awake from the visions, Cid triumphantly declares that he remembers everything─his name, his people, and his purpose. Shortly thereafter, he guides the Enterprise through Garuda's wall of wind without incident, delivering you to the Howling Eye at long last. Speak with Alphinaud before proceeding into the primal's sanctuary.

Alphinaud declares that the end is at hand─be it Garuda's or your own. Strike fear into the hearts of beastmen across Eorzea by defeating the Lady of the Vortex.

※Challenge the Howling Eye with other players via the Duty Finder, or with a party of NPCs via Duty Support. Both systems are accessible from the main menu as well as the trial's entrance point.

Amidst the whirling winds, you succeed in striking down the Lady of the Vortex, only to see her rise once more, reinvigorated by the belief of her Ixali disciples. Yet the beastmen's prayers come to naught when Garuda's attempt to temper you fails, prompting a mysterious force to tear a Crystal of Light from her breast. It is at this moment that Gaius van Baelsar enters the fray, seemingly bent on goading the defeated primal into one final act of defiance. Garuda duly obliges, slaughtering her captive kobolds and Amalj'aa, whose cries of agony serve to summon their own patron deities. As Garuda prepares to consume the aether of her lesser brethren, the Black Wolf calls forth an unknown imperial weapon which summarily dispatches and seemingly absorbs all three primals. Wholly unprepared to face this awe-inspiring new foe, you have no choice but to flee for your life.

Safely back aboard the Enterprise, with the imperial forces now fast-diminishing specks upon the horizon, Cid and Alphinaud begin to discuss how to address this grave new threat. Believing the best course of action is to reform the Scions of the Seventh Dawn, they decide to return to the Waking Sands. Having safely arrived in Ul'dah, speak with Alphinaud prior to continuing on to Vesper Bay.

Alphinaud reiterates that the beast tribes and their primals are no longer a threat, and that all efforts must now be focused upon destroying the Empire's ultimate weapon. But having seen what you have seen, it is plain that this task will ask far more of you than any you have undertaken thus far. For Eorzea's sake, you must hope that you are up to the challenge.
objectives: Confront Garuda in the Howling Eye.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: According to my tests, the device is now functioning in perfect harmony with the crystal─meaning we can leave whenever you're ready.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: But you must understand: tests can only tell one so much.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Until we approach the Howling Eye─until we attempt to breach the barrier itself...I cannot be sure that this will work.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I think it only fair to tell you that there is a small but statistically significant chance that the crystal could trigger a massive...

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Hmmm... Mayhap it is better that we remain positive.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Forename, I want to thank you. For reuniting me with my ship, for trusting in me to develop this plan...for everything. You've helped me to rediscover a part of myself I'd forgotten. I am not the man I once was, and I do not know if I ever shall be...but I do know one thing: this feels right.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: ...My apologies for the sudden outpouring of sentiment. I would have waited until after the mission, but...well, you understand.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: There...she's ready...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Ah, she stirs...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: To Coerthas! And an audience with the harpy queen Garuda!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Enterprise...engage!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Phew...

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Damn it!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I...I once flew in this airship. And I was not alone.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: There were adventurers on board...adventurers like you.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Just how long have I worn these damn goggles?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Ah, yes. I fancied myself a trendsetter in my younger days.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: The young prodigy, admired by all...exactly like his father.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Born and raised in Garlemald...

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: It was only natural that the precocious young student should become an engineer. Had his father not done the same?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Father... When did we stop seeing eye to eye?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: When did Meteor become your everything, and your loved ones cease to matter?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: You abandoned us all. But he was there for me, Father─there for me when you were not.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Though he proved no better in the end. Gaius was just another man with an all-consuming obsession.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: And so I ran─left the Empire behind and came to Eorzea, where I built the Ironworks.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Ah, yes! It was then that I first donned these goggles.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Eorzea opened my eyes. It was home to so many manner of people, each with their own hopes and dreams. People worth saving. And so I fought beside them.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I wanted to prove that my knowledge could serve a nobler purpose.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I wanted to prove that there was another way...

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: And it all began that day, when I found my new home...

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I had forgotten how wonderful it was. The wind in your hair, the endless sky...

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: That light─it was you, wasn't it?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: It's surprising how few people know this, but all pureblood Garleans have a third eye.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Perhaps mine helped me recognize you─or perhaps it was just a lucky guess.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: The Enterprise was made for this! To carry Eorzea's protectors into battle!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I am proud to be able to call her my own.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Cid─what exactly do you remember?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Alphinaud, my boy─sorry to have been such a burden.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I remember everything...

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: My name, my people, and my purpose. Everything.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Come! It would be rude to keep Garuda waiting!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: It took a while for the memory to return, but I remember you.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: The floating isle, van Darnus... We ended it, that day─or so we thought.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Listen─let's keep this between the two of us, for the time being.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: If word got out that one of the Warriors of Light had returned, the eyes of the world would soon be upon us─our enemies' included. And that's the kind of attention we could well do without.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: What, isn't it enough that I know the truth?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Don't worry. A womanman of your talents won't go unnoticed for long. Someday, they will remember you─and you'll never know another moment's peace!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: There, up ahead! Ready, old friend?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Hah! Some things never change! We're going in!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: All our efforts...all our travails...all of it was for this.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Make ready, Forename, for the end is nigh─be it hers or our own.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Beyond those gates awaits our foe. Are you prepared to meet with her?

dialogue.name: GARUDA
dialogue.text: (-???-)Who dares intrude upon my sanctuary!?

dialogue.name: GARUDA
dialogue.text: (-???-)Your insolence shall not go unpunished, landwalkers!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Twelve preserve...she's...she's huge!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: As I live and breathe...

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Over there─look.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Amalj'aa and kobold prisoners. But why would the Ixal bring them here...?

dialogue.name: GARUDA
dialogue.text: Heehee HAHA hahaha HEEHEE haha HEEEEEE!!!

dialogue.name: GARUDA
dialogue.text: Wherefore come you hither, foolish mortals!?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Garuda! We are come to put an end to your reign of terror!

dialogue.name: GARUDA
dialogue.text: Hear you this blasphemy, my children? These landwalkers would bring me low!

dialogue.name: GARUDA
dialogue.text: You who are bound to crawl upon the earth should revere me─FOR I AM THE WIND!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Did we not take to the skies, and slip your defenses!? We are bound by nothing, Garuda!

dialogue.name: GARUDA
dialogue.text: You think your playthings give you strength?

dialogue.name: GARUDA
dialogue.text: They will not help you here, landwalker. This is my realm, where none can challenge my supremacy! Struggle though you may─I shall slake the roots with your blood, and festoon the canopy with your ENTRAILS! HAHAHAHAHAAA!

dialogue.name: IXALGURU
dialogue.text: Squaaawk! Slay the unfeathered ones, we shall! As an offering to Garuda, they will serve!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Leave the Ixal to us, Forename! We will keep them distracted while you deal with her!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Do not fail, Forename! Remember: you fight for the Scions! For Eorzea!

dialogue.name: GARUDA
dialogue.text: This worm would die by mine own hand! Come, then...I shall grant you that which you seek!

dialogue.name: GARUDA
dialogue.text: No... Nooo! NO! NO!!!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: What!? How in the hells─!?

dialogue.name: GARUDA
dialogue.text: HAHAHAHAHAAA! This...is...MY REALM! You have no hope here! None! NONNNE!!!

dialogue.name: GARUDA
dialogue.text: Did you truly believe you could defy a god, landwalkers!?

dialogue.name: GARUDA
dialogue.text: My power is limitless! My children legion!

dialogue.name: GARUDA
dialogue.text: And they have rendered unto me a wealth of crystals.

dialogue.name: GARUDA
dialogue.text: Their gifts sustain me, their faith empowers me!

dialogue.name: GARUDA
dialogue.text: None save my children will escape the reckoning, mortals! And those who would use my crystals to waken the rest shall realize the folly of their faith!

dialogue.name: GARUDA
dialogue.text: Then all shall worship none but me! The one true god! HEE HEE HEE HEE HEEEEEE!!!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...Of course! Worship! So long as the Ixal keep praying, she will never fall!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Then let's stop them!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Ugh!

dialogue.name: GARUDA
dialogue.text:
HAHA hahaha HEEHEE heehee HAHAHA!!!
No harm will come to you, my children!

dialogue.name: GARUDA
dialogue.text: This is only the beginning, landwalkers! All who oppose me shall suffer for their defiance!

dialogue.name: GARUDA
dialogue.text: Soon, the worms of the forest shall receive my judgment! The desert vermin next─their walls of stone will not shield them from the tempest!

dialogue.name: GARUDA
dialogue.text: And then will I take vengeance on the sea lice! Their wooden boats cannot outrun the wind!

dialogue.name: GARUDA
dialogue.text: Tremble, mortals, for I shall visit you all in time! And all shall be mine! ALL MIIINE!!!

dialogue.name: GARUDA
dialogue.text: You, landwalker─you who dared to raise your hand against me─you shall be the first to pay for your sins! Not with your death─but with your LIFE!

dialogue.name: GARUDA
dialogue.text: You will serve me, landwalker...to your last breath!

dialogue.name: GARUDA
dialogue.text: No, NO!!! I claimed you! You should be MINE!

dialogue.name: GARUDA
dialogue.text: What...what are you? What have you done to me!?

dialogue.name: GARUDA
dialogue.text: No mortal should possess such power! This...this is impossible!

dialogue.name: GARUDA
dialogue.text: Why do you not tremble at my might? Why do you not beg for mercy!? Why do you not DIE!?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We've done it!

dialogue.name: IXAL
dialogue.text: Squaaak! Impossible, it is!

dialogue.name: IXAL
dialogue.text: Garuda, kill you all!

dialogue.name: GAIUS
dialogue.text: Is that all!?

dialogue.name: GAIUS
dialogue.text: O Lady of the Vortex! O mighty Garuda!

dialogue.name: GAIUS
dialogue.text: Of all primals, the most terrible. I say again...IS─THAT─ALL!?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Gaius!?

dialogue.name: GAIUS
dialogue.text: Ah, Cid, my boy. You look well─for one who has forsaken kin and country. I wonder, what else you will forsake before the day is done.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: What!?

dialogue.name: GAIUS
dialogue.text: What exactly did you hope to accomplish here this day?

dialogue.name: GAIUS
dialogue.text: Well, I shall accomplish far more!

dialogue.name: GARUDA
dialogue.text: ...Is that all? IS THAT ALL!?

dialogue.name: GARUDA
dialogue.text: Insolent mortal! I shall make you suffer!

dialogue.name: GARUDA
dialogue.text: That foul stench... I see now... She has touched you!

dialogue.name: GARUDA
dialogue.text: Very well...

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Seven hells, does she still mean to fight!?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: What is she─ Twelve preserve, she cannot mean to─

dialogue.name: AMALJAA
dialogue.text: (-Amalj'aa-)O Lord of the Inferno! Almighty Ifrit! Grant us succor in our hour of need!

dialogue.name: KOBOLD
dialogue.text: (-Kobolds-)Save us, Titan, Lord of Crags! Ah, it hurts us so, the pain, the pain...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: No... No, this is all wrong...

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Stop gawping, boy! We must run!

dialogue.name: GARUDA
dialogue.text: Surrender yourselves unto me... I would feast upon your aether. NONE SHALL STAND AGAINST THE WIND!

dialogue.name: GAIUS
dialogue.text: BEAR WITNESS TO THE GLORY OF THE EMPIRE!

dialogue.name: GAIUS
dialogue.text: It is you who will suffer, Garuda!

dialogue.name: GAIUS
dialogue.text: Ancient Allag had ways of dealing with your kind. Now, look on their ultimate weapon, eikon, and despair!

dialogue.name: GARUDA
dialogue.text: No... Nooo! NOOO!

dialogue.name: GAIUS
dialogue.text: Magnificent! It exceeds all expectation!

dialogue.name: LAHABREAEORZEA
dialogue.text: With each primal it consumes, it grows more powerful. A marvel, is it not?

dialogue.name: GAIUS
dialogue.text: Such is the fate of those who oppose the Empire!

dialogue.name: GAIUS
dialogue.text: There will be no Warriors of Light to save you this time.

dialogue.name: GAIUS
dialogue.text: If your leaders are as wise as they are reported, they will surrender.

dialogue.name: GAIUS
dialogue.text: Your skills are impressive, but they will not be enough.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Twelve have mercy! What chance have we against such an ungodly creation!?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: And who was that armored devil!?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: That was Gaius van Baelsar, legatus of the XIVth Imperial Legion, and supreme commander of the Garlean invasion force in Eorzea.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Of course, the Black Wolf─how could I not realize? Grandfather mentions him in his journal!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I was never so naive as to think the man would abandon his ambitions, but these developments are beyond my worst expectations...

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: What have you been doing these past five years? How could something of this magnitude have escaped the Alliance's attention?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We heard no whispers, saw no signs. In the wake of the Calamity, the Empire seized land and built outposts, but that was the extent of their aggression.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Damn it, Gaius, where in the seven hells did you find that thing?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: It has been a day of unexpected developments, but the fact remains: Garuda is no longer a threat.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: While I take no comfort in the manner of her downfall, it does mean that we may safely put the matter of the primals to one side─for the time being, at least.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Which just leaves the matter of Gaius's new toy.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Indeed. That weapon poses the greatest threat to Eorzea. It must be destroyed.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: But first, we must needs find out all we can.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Let us make for Vesper Bay. We shall rebuild the Scions.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: All is not yet lost, my friend─for we bear the light, and shall surely lead our people from the darkness.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Well, that was an experience I would rather not have again.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Something has been troubling me, Forename. Shortly before the Black Wolf took center stage, when Garuda attempted to claim you as her own, I could have sworn I saw...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Ah, but I'm sure I was mistaken. In times of great stress, the evidence of the eye is apt to be misread by even the most inquiring mind. Forget I mentioned it.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Returning to the subject of our earlier discussion, we may consider the matter of the primals closed until further notice. No beast tribe will dare summon their god so long as that weapon exists.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Truly, a more effective deterrent I could not imagine. It almost seems a shame to plot its destruction...

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: You know, it's not easy guiding the Enterprise through a ceaselessly swirling wall of wind. I would rather not risk our lives again until you're sure─meaning absolutely certain─that you're ready. Are you?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: Travel to the Howling Eye?

dialogue.name: LIONNELLAIS
dialogue.text: Greetings, madamsir. Do you wish to proceed to your vessel?

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: Proceed to the landing area?

dialogue.name: ELYENORA
dialogue.text: Greetings, madamsir. Do you wish to proceed to your vessel?

dialogue.name: Q4
dialogue.text: Proceed to the landing area?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No
